title: Long way to achieve complete equality for girl children: Calcutta High Court's Port Blair Bench
content: The Port Blair sessions court had discharged the woman’s in-laws, accused of torturing her and demanding dowry from her parents, especially after she gave birth to a girl child. She killed her daughter and herself in 2021.

title: Govt-oppn lock horns in Lok Sabha, House adjourned for day
content: The Lok Sabha proceedings were adjourned twice earlier – once at 11 a.m. when the business of the day began and again after a few minutes of proceedings at 12 noon

title: Police head constable suspended over viral video of him abusing workers at Erode eatery
content: CCTV footage shows the constable damaging items in the shop, using abusive language, and attempting to assault the workers

title: Owaisi seeks action against Assam CM over ‘point-blank shot’ video
content: The video, which was posted by the Assam BJP on 'X' and later removed, allegedly showed Mr. Sarma taking aim with a rifle and firing a shot at two individuals—one wearing a skull cap and the other sporting a beard—with the caption "point-blank shot”

title: DMK MP Tiruchi Siva moves privilege notice against Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
content: Mr. Siva contends that Mr. Goyal held a press conference on the Indo-US trade deal before briefing the Parliament. When the Parliament is in session, all executive decisions have to be shared with Parliament before going to press.

title: Jana Nayagan producer to withdraw writ petition from Madras High Court
content: The writ petition is expected to be listed under the caption ‘For Withdrawal’ before Justice P.T. Asha on Tuesday since KVN Productions LLP has agreed for the reference to the revising committee

title: BJP believes in nation first, Opposition in self-interest first, feels party chief Nitin Nabin
content: In his first visit to his home State of Bihar since becoming BJP chief, Mr. Nabin says he got the opportunity to visit States like Kerala and West Bengal, ‘where party workers are making sacrifices, without worrying about what they are going to get in return’

title: Home Minister calls meeting to review progress of safety measures by KSCA for hosting cricket matches at M. Chinnaswamy stadium in Bengaluru
content: Delegation meets Minister requesting clearances for inclusion of Bengaluru in the schedule for international cricket matches and the IPL tournament

title: In Pictures: Inside Tata Motors-Jaguar Land Rover manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu
content: Images from the Tata Motors-Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) plant established in Tamil Nadu. The luxury car manufacturing facility was opened on February 9, 2026

title: Kerala Public Expenditure Review Committee calls for revenue boost, spending rationalisation for long-term growth
content: First report of 7th KPERC, for the period 2021-22 to 2023-24, observes that Kerala is operating in ‘an increasingly constrained and less-than-supportive Centre-State fiscal environment’

title: PM did not come to Lok Sabha fearing not because of threat from MPs: Rahul Gandhi
content: Rahul Gandhi said the government is scared of having a discussion on the Budget because of the issue of the U.S. deal, the way it was done, and its impact on farmers

title: Punjab law college student kills woman classmate inside classroom, shoots self
content: CCTV footage from the classroom shows the first-year law student getting up from a bench and shooting his classmate in the head before turning the gun on himself

title: Actors to blame for budget overruns and production delays, alleges FEFKA general secretary B. Unnikrishnan
content: FEFKA and Kerala Film Producers’ Association sign agreement revising service conditions of film workers

title: Fear grips Thalavadi Hills amid rising human-elephant conflict
content: In the early hours of Sunday (February 8, 2026), Mahesh, 28, of Karalavadi village was trampled to death by a herd of elephants while attempting, along with other farmers, to drive them away from agricultural fields

title: SC terms siphoning of over ₹54,000 cr by digital fraud ‘dacoity’, asks Centre to frame SoP
content: The Bench has also noted that the RBI has crafted an SOP prescribing action by the banks to temporarily hold debit cards to prevent cyber-enabled fraud.

title: Watch: Surajkund swing collapse: Family mourns death of Haryana police inspector
content: The grieving family members of deceased Haryana Police Inspector Jagdish Prasad from Mathura say that they remember him as a caring person, who was hoping for a quiet life with his loved ones post his retirement in March.

title: Kerala Public Expenditure Review Committee flags IGST settlement shortfall as ‘major concern and a puzzle’
content: First report of 7th KPERC covering the period from 2021-22 to 2023-24 was tabled in Kerala Assembly recently

title: Supreme Court requests Delhi HC to give Sengar appeal in custodial death case ‘out-of-turn’ hearing
content: The High Court had reasoned that Sengar had nothing new to say than what was argued in a similar plea filed in June 2024 for suspension of sentence

title: SIR hearing highlights: Supreme Court orders extension of time for objections in West Bengal SIR by a week from Feb. 14
content: EROs should consider all or any of the documents listed in the SIR notice, in additon to the documents mentioned in the SC order (admit card, Aadhaar, etc) during verification in the claim/objections phase, the SC order adds

title: Centre to consider setting up inquiry for not allotting flats in Delhi under JNNURM: Manohar Lal
content: It was in response to Rajya Sabha Member Swati Maliwal, who said that only 4,871 flats were allotted to the poor out of the total 52,344 flats constructed

title: Uddanam residents urge Forest department to trap bears moving in groves
content: A bear which was trapped in the fence has been shifted to Visakhapatnam Zoological Park for treatment on Sunday

title: Maoism never benefitted society, caused destruction, says Amit Shah
content: The Union Home Minister urged Maoists to surrender and joint the mainstream, promising them dignified rehabilitation

title: Tata Motors opens ₹9,000-crore Jaguar Land Rover car manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu’s Ranipet
content: Speaking at the inauguration, Chief Minister M.K. Stalin said Tamil Nadu was proud to witness the expansion of world-class automotive manufacturing

title: Supreme Court sets aside HC order staying decision to shift H.P. OBC Commission from Shimla
content: The Bench led by Chief Justice of India said such issues pertain to policy decisions and ordinarily do not fall under the judicial domain

title: Bombay HC grants bail to accused in Baba Siddique murder case
content: The accused, in his bail plea, claimed he was implicated in the case and that the allegations levelled against him were baseless and vague

title: Kerala man booked for raping minor girl under guise of exorcism
content: The accused has been absconding since the assault came to light on Sunday and a search is on to nab him, say police

title: India announces $175 million economic package to Seychelles
content: The two sides also agreed on a broad vision to expand cooperation in areas of sustainability, trade and economy and security

title: Madikeri CMC prohibits defecation and urination in public places
content: The City Municipal Commissioner of Madikeri urged owners of residential and commercial buildings to make use of the municipal suction machine facility for cleaning septic tanks

title: ‘No governance, empty treasury’: Kerala Opposition Leader launches sharp attack on LDF govt
content: V.D. Satheesan says ‘even Left sympathisers do not want LDF to return to power’ and that Kerala is grappling with multiple crises

title: Thiruppurankundram hill Dargah: Prayers only during festival days, says Supreme Court
content: The petition challenged the High Court’s finding that the practice of offering namaz was only of a “recent origin”

title: Bomb threat paralyses Patna Court, Pappu Yadav’s bail plea remains unheard
content: Police personnel, who rushed to the spot to carry out searches, were so far tight-lipped, even as judicial work was suspended for the day

title: Opposition mulling no-confidence motion against Speaker Om Birla
content: Opposition’s plan to move a no-confidence motion comes after a series of contentious sessions in Parliament, marked by suspensions of Opposition MPs and rising tensions over critical national issues

title: Terror suspect Abdul Rehman murdered in Faridabad jail by another inmate
content: Rehman was arrested in March 2025 by the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) and Haryana Special Task Force (STF) for allegedly being in possession of two hand grenades

title: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya detained for protesting against Bengaluru metro fare hike
content: Bharatiya Janata Party MP Tejasvi Surya was detained and later released by police on February 9 near Jayanagar metro station in Bengaluru.

title: T.N. CM Stalin extends free meal scheme to another one lakh conservancy workers in civic bodies
content: The expansion, launched by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin during an event at Polivakkam in Tiruvallur district, would benefit 48,768 workers in 24 Corporations, 29,556 workers in 145 Municipalities, and 21,910 workers in 479 town panchayats

title: Wait for action: Congress amid reports that Opposition may move no confidence motion against Speaker
content: “The Speaker is making allegations against Congress women MPs. There is no space for Opposition in this house at all," Mr. Venugopal told reporters

title: In message to India, Jamaat chief says election will show ‘red card’ to forces of ‘hegemony’
content: Ameer of Jamaat-E-Islami Dr. Shafiqur Rahman accused the Bangladesh Nationalist Party as responsible for many challenges facing the country

title: Fire guts scrapyards on outskirts of Mysuru
content: Regional Fire Officer Chandan said the blaze may have originated due to an ‘unscientific’ method used to extract copper by burning electric wires

title: Hole in govt approach: Congress’ dig over Ministers' remarks on Russian oil
content: Jairam Ramesh said Prime Minister Narendra Modi "talks big of what he calls a 'whole of government' approach"

title: Kerala CPI(M) State secretary demands Congress High Command clarify stance on UDF’s support from Jamaat
content: M.V. Govindan says ‘spreading lies has become the job’ of Opposition Leader and that the latter has become ‘the coordinator’ of ‘KoLiBi’ (Congress-Muslim League-BJP)-JIH alliance

title: Meghalaya Government orders judicial inquiry into illegal coal mine blast that claimed 27 lives
content: A senior officer of the Home Department said the judicial inquiry would examine the circumstances leading to the incident, fix responsibility and recommend measures to prevent such tragedies in future

title: Pariksha Pe Charcha: Use technology to hone skills, improve potential, says PM Modi to students
content: In the second episode of Pariksha Pe Charcha, Mr. Modi noted that mobile phones have become masters of some children, who cannot even eat food without them or without a television screen

title: Congress slams RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat over meal with Adnan Sami
content: The Opposition party said that Adnan Sami's father had served as a pilot in the Pakistan Air Force and was involved in the 1965 India-Pakistan war, including the attack on the Pathankot air base

title: Supreme Court adjourns WhatsApp-Meta privacy policy case to Feb. 23
content: The Supreme Court is hearing appeals from tech giants Meta Platforms and WhatsApp against a CCI order imposing a penalty of ₹213.14 crore on them over their privacy policy

title: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya detained while protesting against proposed Namma Metro fare hike in Bengaluru
content: On February 8, the BJP MP was served a notice for staging a protest at a Namma Metro station without prior notification to the police

title: Manipur’s Ukhrul tense after night of arson
content: Deputy Chief Minister Losii Dikho is scheduled to visit the volatile Litan area in a bid to douse the fire

title: Bennehalla flood control project launched to help 37 villages in two north Karnataka districts
content: During the monsoon, flash floods occur in villages on the banks of the Bennehalla stream, causing immense damage in 37 villages of Dharwad and Gadag districts

title: Kanpur accident: U.P. businessman’s son ploughs speeding luxury car into people; six injured
content: Eyewitnesses said the car first hit an auto-rickshaw and then crashed into a parked Royal Enfield motorcycle, flinging its rider nearly 10 feet into the air

title: Karnataka prioritises competitive exam scores in new teacher recruitment rules, fuels fears of encouraging coaching centres
content: A teacher aspirant alleged that the government has created an environment where it is impossible to get a job without coaching

title: Bomb scare at over 10 Delhi schools; search operations underway
content: According to the Delhi Fire Services, emergency calls were received from multiple educational institutions across different parts of the city in the morning hours

title: History-sheeter booked for cheating and criminal intimidation
content: As per the police, Ayub Khan, a rowdy-sheeter, lured the victim into a business partnership in 2024, and asked him to invest ₹4.70 lakh

title: Bhatti tears into BRS on penultimate day of electioneering
content: “Should people vote for a party that looted the State for 10 years,” Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka asked while addressing a public meeting.

title: Hyderabad police commissioner presents awards to 1,446 personnel, introduces ‘Extra Mile’ recognition
content: The awardees included Additional Deputy Commissioners of Police, Assistant Commissioners of Police, inspectors, sub inspectors, assistant sub inspectors, head constables, constables, home guards, ministerial staff and public prosecutors.

title: Elephant runs amok at temple, mahout injured
content: The tusker, Chamapuzha Unnikrishnan, ran amok around 8.15 p.m. when it was being brought to the temple to be paraded during the Athazha seeveli ritual

title: Artists perform at weekly cultural programme on Marina Blue Flag beach
content: The Greater Chennai Corporation has been conducting weekly cultural events at the Blue Flag beach since September 21, 2025, with programmes scheduled every Sunday evening

title: Rameswaram airport: AAI submits pre-feasibility report, finds site near Keelakarai feasible
content: When compared to the site near Uchipuli, which has a lot of trees, paddy fields, groundwater wells, and residents, the site close to Keelakarai has lesser obstacles and residents as seen from the initial inspection

title: Budget may cut reliance on foreign telescopes, but trips on space spending
content: Only a few large astronomical observatories are capable of groundbreaking discoveries worldwide, which means researchers have to compete for observation time. When funding agencies favour their own national researchers, international scientists’ access becomes increasingly restricted, and Indians are no exception

title: AAP leaders accuse Congress’ Bajwa of making derogatory remark against Punjab Cabinet Minister
content: Congress leaders, however, rejected the charge and accused the AAP of attempting to twist facts and misuse the sensitive issue of Dalits for political mileage by levelling false allegations against Partap Singh Bajwa

title: Missing sub-inspector from U.P.’s Basti found dead in Ayodhya; probe on
content: The deceased was identified as Sub-Inspector Ajay Gaur, who was posted at the Parsarampur police station in Basti district. He had gone missing under suspicious circumstances on February 5

title: Himachal CM Sukhu warns against scrapping Revenue Deficit Grants, urges cross-party appeal to PM
content: The Chief Minister said that already in the post-GST regime, the tax collection growth has come down to around 8%, which was 13% to 14% before the implementation of GST

title: India Stonemart 2026 concludes with call for ecological balance with safe mining
content: Governor Haribhau Bagade stated that Rajasthan excels in stone mining, diversity, and exports, emphasising that ensuring social security in the industry is both a policy issue and a moral responsibility

title: Nearly 3,000 found ineligible to be included on voters’ list in Ernakulam
content: Special Intensive Revision of voter rolls is entering its final phase in the district; most of those found ineligible are deceased; 19,021 persons excluded from voter rolls across the State

title: People against hate: Uttarakhand residents resist rising communal tensions
content: For decades, Uttarakhand was known more for its pilgrimages and forests than for communal discord. In recent years, however, communal tensions have surfaced repeatedly across its towns, accompanied by a parallel, even if fringe, development: regular citizens pushing back, standing firm on coexistence, and rejecting the hate that has increasingly spilled onto the streets

title: Tirupattur police ask tribal people to surrender country-made firearms
content: Tirupattur Superintendent of Police P. Shymala Devi makes the request to tribal inhabitants of Yelagiri and Jawadhu Hills as part of a special awareness drive on illegal firearms and poaching

title: A year on, demands of surrendered Maoists remain unfulfilled
content: Sluggish rehabilitation process is nothing but betrayal of surrendered Maoists’ trust, says committee

title: In a first, a visually challenged woman all set to become a judge in Kerala
content: Thanya Nathan C. has been ranked first on the merit list of persons with benchmark disabilities in the recently held judicial service examination for the selection of Civil Judges (Junior Division) in the Kerala Judicial Service

title: Police, Excise launch intensive raid in Perumbavoor; nine NDPS cases registered
content: Three migrant women found in lodges without valid documents taken into custody during the drive; police to form committee to address law and order issues involving migrants and local residents

title: Lack of feed affects milk production in T.N.; Karnataka does better
content: According to Basic Animal Husbandry (BAH) statistics, Tamil Nadu has lost area under fodder crops, while Karnataka has improved its coverage

title: PM Modi vows stronger India-Malaysia ties in strategic pivot; says ‘no compromise’ on terrorism
content: The countries sign agreements in key areas, including defence and semiconductors; PM Modi and Malaysian PM highlight efforts to promote trade in local currencies during talks in Kuala Lumpur

title: Namma Metro fare hike put on hold after public backlash; BMRCL to review decision
content: The rollback follows widespread criticism from commuters and a political slugfest, with both the BJP and the Congress attempting to pin responsibility for the proposed hike on the other

title: Islamiah College in Tirupattur inks MOU
content: According to a press release, the agreement signifies a new chapter in strengthening the innovation ecosystem

title: Nothing left to prove, resilient Sam Darnold makes ultimate statement
content: The QB isn't motivated to prove the haters wrong, but to prove people right. And on Sunday, he did just that.

title: Dominant D carries Seahawks to Super Bowl win
content: The Seahawks smothered Drake Maye and the Patriots 29-13 to claim the second Super Bowl title in franchise history.

title: Seahawks' Walker, 'one of one,' earns MVP honors
content: Buoyed by a first-half surge in which he outgained the entire Patriots offense, Seahawks running back Kenneth Walker III, a pending unrestricted free agent, earned MVP honors as Seattle ran to a 29-13 victory Sunday.

title: Maye: Had injection for ailing shoulder before loss
content: Patriots QB Drake Maye acknowledged he received a pain-killing injection for his injured right throwing shoulder before Sunday's loss, but maintained he was "good to go" for the game and just didn't make enough plays in the end.

title: Kubiak confirms he's taking Raiders' coaching job
content: Seahawks OC Klint Kubiak confirmed on NFL Network following the team's Super Bowl win over the Patriots on Sunday night that he will be leaving Seattle to take over as coach of the Raiders.

title: 'Quad God,' U.S. defend figure skating team gold
content: Ilia Malinin beat Japanese rival Shun Sato in a head-to-head showdown at the Milan Cortina Olympics, helping the U.S. defend its team figure skating gold medal.

title: Sources: 49ers not planning to trade QB Jones
content: The 49ers have no plans to trade quarterback Mac Jones this offseason and fully intend to bring him back as Brock Purdy's backup, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Vonn has leg surgery after crashing at Olympics
content: Lindsey Vonn's bid to win the Winter Olympic downhill ended in a frightening crash that left her with a broken leg.

title: Trump rips Olympian Hess for comments on U.S.
content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Sunday said that it is hard to cheer for American Olympians who are speaking out against administration policies.

title: Next season already? Our way-too-early NFL Power Rankings stack all 32 teams for 2026
content: After the conclusion of the 2025 NFL season, how do all 32 teams stack up for 2026? Here are our early rankings for next season.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Eileen Gu competes for gold, U.S. women's hockey plays Switzerland and more live updates
content: On Monday at the Winter Olympics, Gu aims to win her first gold of 2026, U.S. women's hockey plays again and snowboard big air medals will be awarded.

title: We ranked every Super Bowl champion, 1-60: How do the 2025 Seahawks stack up?
content: How good was the 2025 Seahawks team? We ranked the Super Bowl LX winner against the other 59 champions.

title: Bracketology: Are the No. 1 seeds already locked in?
content: Texas' win over LSU on Thursday makes it tougher for teams such as the Tigers or Vanderbilt to get to a 1-seed.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Iowa's inch to lock status, more results from a packed weekend
content: Iowa, USC pulled out wins but Ohio State, UCF, West Virginia, Tulsa have work to do after a mixed bubble Sunday.

title: Bracketology: Saint Louis could be a real threat come March
content: The Billikens are an analytical unicorn -- and shaping up to be the Atlantic 10's next generational team.

title: Man City's comeback thriller keeps title hopes alive; Liverpool slip further
content: Liverpool looked set to win it, but Man City's two unanswered goals means the Premier League title race stays alive and Liverpool's Champions League hopes are in doubt.

title: Arsenal stun Man City to boost their UWCL hopes and keep WSL title race alive
content: Arsenal's rejuvenated form since the turn of the year continued on Sunday with a 1-0 win over Women's Super League champions-elect Manchester City.

title: NFL futures: Champion Seahawks, Rams atop Super Bowl LXI odds
content: A champion was just crowned, but it's never too early to look ahead. Here are the odds for Super Bowl LXI.

title: Too soon? Early bets to win Super Bowl LXI
content: We're already thinking about Super Bowl LXI. Here are the contenders and odds that caught our analysts' eyes.

title: 'It's over. Guys are gone': What James Harden and the Clippers realized before the shocking trade
content: The Harden trade was a mutual recognition as much as an admission -- that the 11-time All-Star had a better chance to win elsewhere, and a tumultuous era in LA was effectively over.

title: What NBA insiders are watching amid trade deadline aftermath
content: Tim Bontemps canvases the league after the deadline's grand finale, which now sets up a fascinating summer.

title: America's team: How Cadillac's arrival is already shaking up F1
content: Cadillac is unveiling its first F1 livery in a Super Bowl commercial Sunday night, revealing just how big America's team ambitions are.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want Tonali to replace Casemiro
content: Manchester United are showing an interest in Newcastle United midfielder Sandro Tonali. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: 'Won't allow any impediment in SIR': SC's clear message to states on Mamata's plea
content: The Supreme Court has stated it will not permit any obstacles in the ongoing special intensive revision of electoral rolls across states. This comes as West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee filed a petition challenging the revision process in her poll-bound state.

title: Punjab campus horror: Law student kills girl classmate, then turns gun on himself
content: A shocking murder-suicide unfolded at Usma Law College in Tarn Taran, where a first-year student fatally shot her classmate before taking his own life. Both students, Sandeep Kaur and Prince Raj Singh, were in their first semester. Authorities are investigating the motive, reviewing CCTV footage and witness statements to understand the tragic incident that has left the campus reeling.

title: Watergate Revelations: Nixon asked China to interfere in India-Pak 1971 War
content: In his grand jury testimony, Nixon described a secret assurance given to Beijing during the war. His full statement reads: “The Russians were supporting India. … Nobody was supporting Pakistan because there was an embargo on the shipment of arms. … But we were giving moral support to them, and also we gave to the Chinese an assurance privately that if India jumped Pakistan and China decided to take on the Indians that we would support them.”

title: KL Rahul's century sinks 42-time champions Mumbai, Karnataka enter Ranji's semis
content: KL Rahul scored a brilliant century to lead Karnataka to a four-wicket victory against Mumbai. This win secured Karnataka's place in the Ranji Trophy semifinals. Rahul's 130 runs were crucial in chasing down the target. Ravichandran Smaran also played a vital role with an unbeaten 83. Karnataka will now face Uttarakhand in the next round.

title: After Anthropic wiped trillions off SaaS stocks, its co-founder says: we hire people with EQ, not coders
content: Anthropic's co-founder, Daniela Amodei, revealed that her company prioritizes human qualities like communication and empathy over technical skills for new hires. She believes humanities will become increasingly vital as AI advances, emphasizing that "humans plus AI together actually create more meaningful work.

title: 'Very balanced order': SC upholds Madras high court's deepam nod at Madurai hilltop
content: ​​A bench comprising Justice Aravind Kumar and Justice PB Varale declined to interfere, describing the high court order as balanced. Appearing for the petitioner, Advocate Prashant Bhushan submitted that there has never been a law and order problem in the area. ​​"It seems to be a very very balanced order," Justice Kumar said and Justice Varale agreed with it.

title: After losing historic opening match, Italy hit with more bad news
content: Italy captain Wayne Madsen is likely to miss the rest of the T20 World Cup league stage after dislocating his shoulder while fielding against Scotland. Coach John Davison said scans will determine his return but called it “doubtful.” Despite the setback, Italy showed fight in the chase, and Davison hopes Madsen can still travel with the team and help as part of the coaching staff.

title: Exclusive: I was trying to click the Tsunami ride at Surajkund Mela and it came crashing down
content: The Surajkund International Crafts Mela, a vibrant annual event, was marred by a tragic accident when a swing ride collapsed, injuring 13 people and claiming the life of an SHO who rushed to help. The incident starkly contrasted the festive atmosphere, highlighting the fragile line between celebration and disaster.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
content: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." Employees seek transparency on contracts, a Q&A session, and protection for all workers, calling for an end to complicity in government actions.

title: 6 hurt as Lamborghini rams auto, bike in Kanpur; tycoon's son named in FIR
content: Recalling the horror, the eyewitnesses told news agency PTI that the car first hit an autorickshaw and then crashed into a stationary motorcycle, flinging its rider nearly 10 feet into the air. The car mounted the motorcycle's front wheel and dragged it for some distance before hitting an electric pole and coming to a halt.

title: 3 wives, 1 dead live-in partner, 3 dead daughters: Ghaziabad suicide case reveals grim past
content: Three minor sisters tragically ended their lives in Ghaziabad, leaping from their ninth-floor apartment. Investigations revealed a complex family dynamic, with the girls deeply engrossed in Korean culture. Their diary entries suggest intense frustration over parental opposition to their interests and a profound sense of isolation, hinting at a desperate cry for understanding.

title: As cos lose trillions in market cap, China & South Korea warn against an AI agent
content: Global software companies have seen over a trillion in market value losses, triggered by Anthropic's AI tool. Concerns over open-source AI agents like OpenClaw are growing, leading South Korea and China to restrict its use due to security and data privacy risks. OpenClaw, designed to perform real-world actions for LLMs, is raising alarms about potential data leaks and cyberattacks.

title: Assam CM 'point-bank' video row: Owaisi files compaint, calls it 'genocidal hate speech'
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has lodged a formal complaint with Hyderabad police. He seeks criminal action against Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma. This is over a now-deleted video allegedly showing Sarma shooting at Muslims. Owaisi stated genocidal hate speech has become a norm. The complaint cites Sarma's repeated statements targeting the Muslim community.

title: NCP(SP) chief Sharad Pawar hospitalised in Pune after health concerns
content: Veteran leader Sharad Pawar was admitted to a Pune hospital after experiencing a persistent cough and breathing difficulties. Doctors confirmed a chest infection following a CT scan. Accompanied by his daughter Supriya Sule, the 85-year-old leader is under close medical observation, with further treatment decisions pending test results.

title: ‘Lost a bit of power’: Ponting, Shastri on why Babar stands at a crossroads
content: Ricky Ponting and Ravi Shastri are questioning Pakistan's approach to Babar Azam at the T20 World Cup, citing his slow starts and perceived loss of power. Experts suggest a more aggressive batting style and potentially a change in batting order to alleviate pressure on the star batter.

title: 'Krrish 4' stalled as Hrithik Roshan and Aditya Chopra at odds over Rs 500 crore budget - Reports
content: Fans face a delay for 'Krrish 4' as Hrithik Roshan and producer Aditya Chopra clash over a Rs. 500 crore budget versus Rs. 350 crore. Hrithik, also directing, aims for international superhero standards, while Chopra prioritizes commercial viability. The project is on hold, with Hrithik exploring other studios and script revisions. Priyanka Chopra Jonas is reportedly returning.

title: 'My wife visited Pak for work-related purpose': Gaurav Gogoi on Assam CM's allegations
content: Assam Congress chief Gaurav Gogoi has strongly denied allegations made by Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma linking him to Pakistan. Gogoi called the claims false and demanded the immediate release of an SIT report to prove his innocence. He accused the Chief Minister of targeting his family and a community.

title: What are Tier-2 cities and why they’re hotspots for real estate investment
content: India's real estate is booming, with Tier 2 cities emerging as key investment hubs. Driven by improved infrastructure, enhanced liveability, and stable growth, these mid-sized urban centers offer affordable living and rising property values. Developers are increasingly investing here, signaling a shift towards more predictable, end-user-focused markets offering a better quality of life.

title: Unnao rape case: SC rejects Kuldeep Sengar’s bail plea, asks HC for ‘out of turn’ hearing
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Delhi High Court to expedite the hearing of former BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar's plea for bail and suspension of sentence in the Unnao rape victim's father's custodial death case. This comes after the High Court previously denied him bail in the matter, which stems from a 2018 FIR.

title: IT stock crash! Rs 2.5 lakh crore erased in 3 Days — What should investors do?
content: Indian IT shares have plummeted, losing Rs 2.5 lakh crore as AI automation threatens traditional outsourcing. New tools from Anthropic and Palantir, capable of rapid SAP migrations, have spooked investors. Analysts predict a significant revenue hit, though historical disruptions have ultimately spurred industry growth. Investors are now cautiously assessing the sector's AI-driven future.

title: Keir Starmer out, Shabana Mahmood in? How Epstein files could lead to UK's first Muslim PM
content: Starmer is not accused of misconduct, and Mandelson has consistently denied any impropriety. Yet British politics does not operate solely on legal thresholds. It operates on perception, timing and instinct. The renewed attention on Epstein has revived a broader unease about elite networks, proximity to power and the sense that some figures are insulated from consequences. In that climate, Mandelson’s return has become a liability rather than an asset, raising uncomfortable questions not about guilt, but about judgement.

title: ‘Ticked every box’: Gautam Gambhir’s bold verdict on Suryakumar Yadav’s captaincy
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir lauded T20I skipper Suryakumar Yadav for his calm leadership, stating the captain's man-management skills have significantly eased the coaching role. Gambhir highlighted Suryakumar's ability to connect with players and foster a relaxed dressing-room atmosphere, emphasizing his effectiveness under pressure and his crucial role in India's campaign.

title: Big blow for Azzurri: Italy captain injured as T20 World Cup dream turns sour
content: Italy's T20 World Cup debut was marred by captain Wayne Madsen's serious shoulder injury early in their match against Scotland.  While Madsen was sidelined, Scotland's George Munsey smashed 84, guiding them to a formidable 207/4, the tournament's first 200+ score.  The extent of Madsen's injury and his future participation remain uncertain.

title: Beyond patriarchy: How the 'duty' men created became their greatest source of isolation
content: A significant number of Indian men grapple with profound loneliness, often masked by societal expectations of stoicism and duty. This widespread issue, extending beyond romantic relationships, stems from cultural norms that discourage emotional expression.  Addressing this requires integrated mental health support and community initiatives, moving beyond blame to foster understanding and well-being for all.

title: Nayara refinery's future unsure: India may bargain with US for Russian crude
content: US President Trump's threat of a 25% "penalty" on Indian crude imports casts a shadow over the Nayara refinery, majority-owned by Russia's Rosneft. This situation fuels speculation about a change in ownership, as prospective buyers may be deterred by US sanctions.

title: Gold price today: How much 24K, 22K and 18K gold costs today? Check rates for your city
content: Gold experienced significant gains on Monday, reaching Rs 1.57 lakh per 10 grams. This surge was driven by a rebound in global markets, a weaker US dollar, and increased demand for safe-haven assets. Silver also saw substantial increases in futures trading, climbing nearly 5%.

title: When Saif Ali Khan said he never forced Amrita Singh to convert to Islam, was concerned about kids
content: Saif Ali Khan and Amrita Singh's inter-faith marriage in 1991 saw Saif respecting Amrita's religious choices, a principle he extended to their children, Sara and Ibrahim. Despite initial concerns post-divorce regarding their upbringing in Amrita's custody, Saif trusted her to maintain their religious balance. The wedding itself was a unique blend of traditions.

title: Liberty cannot be kept in limbo: Supreme court fixes timelines for bail applications
content: The Supreme Court pointed out that, although anticipatory bail under Section 438 CrPC is not a fundamental right but a statutory right, the delay in dispensing bail applications by the courts constitutes a direct implication of Article 21.

title: 'Chanafali bech rahe the kya?': Ex-Pakistan cricketer's brutal attack on PAK batters
content: Pakistan narrowly escaped defeat against the Netherlands in their T20 World Cup opener, thanks to a late surge from Faheem Ashraf. Despite a disciplined bowling effort, the batting faltered, drawing sharp criticism from former cricketer Basit Ali, who questioned the middle order's temperament and the team's lack of match-winners.  Stronger batting displays are now crucial.

title: Gold recovers to Rs 1.58 lakh/ 10 grams, silver rises Rs 10,000 - top 10 things to know
content: Gold, silver price today: Gold and silver prices have rebounded on Monday after last week’s crash. The yellow metal and white metal are up both in international and domestic markets.

title: GDP growth at 6.4%! India to continue as fastest G-20 economy; banks to remain resilient
content: India is poised to lead G-20 economic growth, with real GDP projected to expand by 6.4% in fiscal 2026-27. Moody's anticipates a stable banking sector, supported by improving asset quality, strong capital, healthy profits, and ample liquidity. Despite challenges in deposit mobilization, government support will bolster public sector banks.

title: Rs 3cr Lamborghini, Rs 37-lakh tax dodge: Anonymous email exposes 'supercar scam'
content: An anonymous tip-off has triggered a probe into an alleged Rs 37 lakh road tax evasion on a black Lamborghini Huracan Evo. Investigators uncovered forged invoices and fabricated ownership records, suggesting an attempt to undervalue the luxury vehicle and avoid tax dues. The owner of H1 Car Care and the original buyer are now named as accused.

title: In a 1st for India, desi company gains in-orbit snooping capability, takes ISS pics
content: India's space sector has achieved a significant milestone as Azista Space successfully imaged the International Space Station from its own satellite. This groundbreaking "space watch" capability, demonstrated by the ABA First Runner satellite, marks a first for any Indian company. The feat enhances India's space situational awareness, crucial for protecting national assets in orbit.

title: 'Getting back to what I love': Harshit Rana shares big update after surgery
content: India pacer Harshit Rana has undergone successful knee surgery and is now focused on recovery after being ruled out of the T20 World Cup. He sustained the injury during a warm-up match against South Africa, leading to Mohammed Siraj's inclusion as his replacement in the squad.

title: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Yasir Arafat: 'IPL’s rise reshaped cricket'
content: Former Pakistan all-rounder Yasir Arafat, who is currently the bowling coach of the UAE team in the ongoing 2026 T20 World Cup, explains why injuries are increasing among fast bowlers, how the modern calendar impacts recovery, and why there is no single formula for success in T20Is.

title: BJP’s ‘achche din’ due to RSS, not the other way round: Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat advocated for a Uniform Civil Code, emphasizing consensus-building and preserving unity in diversity. He also called for global Hindu unity, a Bharat Ratna for Veer Savarkar, and reiterated a three-child policy, linking population decline to conversion and illegal immigration.

title: ‘Delhi will become Khalistan’: Several schools receive bomb threats; Parliament cited as target
content: Delhi schools were thrown into panic on Monday after receiving multiple bomb threat messages. Security agencies responded swiftly, evacuating school premises and initiating thorough checks. Police are currently investigating to determine the origin of these alarming threats.

title: Analysis: Generative AI And Incel Ideology - Dangerous Mix And Security Threat
content: Most people have used Generative AI tools like ChatGPT, Gemini and Perplexity for brainstorming, sometimes even seeking answers during an emotional crisis. But what happens when resentment, revenge, sexism and misogyny intersect with AI?

title: Pet Dogs Are Turning 'Wild' Because Of War Between These Two Countries
content: The Russia-Ukraine war is turning once-household pets into animals that resemble wild dog species, a new study has found.

title: Bengaluru Woman Dies By Suicide After Husband's Death Due To Gas Geyser Leak
content: A tragic incident has been reported from Bettanagere village in Bengaluru, where a woman died by suicide after her husband died following a gas geyser leak at their residence, police said.

title: Systemic Exploitation Of Farmers At Mandis: Naveen Patnaik To Mohan Majhi
content: Odisha's Leader of the Opposition Naveen Patnaik on Monday urged Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi to honour the electoral promises made by the BJP regarding paddy procurement, alleging that farmers were facing "systemic exploitation" at mandis.

title: Live Updates - "Won't Allow Any Impediment To SIR Process": Top Court's Big Message
content: Bengal SIR Hearing Live Updates: The Supreme Court is hearing the Election Commission's reply to West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's petition challenging the special intensive revision (SIR) in the state.

title: Noor Hossain: The Iconic Bangladeshi Activist Who Took Down A Dictator
content: As Bangladesh moves towards another national election, the country's political calendar turns back to its defining moments. Under deposed former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's rule, rallies filled the streets, opposition leaders faced restrictions.

title: Putin Named 1,005 Times In Epstein Files. In Some, He Hoped For A Meet
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin's name appears 1,005 times in the 3.5 million pages of correspondence linked to the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, released by the US Department of Justice.

title: Tobacco Baron's 'Drunk' Son Goes On Rampage In Speeding 10-Crore Lamborghini
content: Kanpur Lamborghini crash: A speeding Lamborghini Revuelto, allegedly being driven by the son of a tobacco tycoon KK Mishra, triggered chaos in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur, after it rammed pedestrians and several vehicles. At least six were injured.

title: Mumbai To Get London-Like Congestion Tax? Corporator's Push To Curb Traffic
content: A senior Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) corporator from Mumbai has renewed debate over tackling traffic chaos and worsening air quality in India's financial capital with a proposal to introduce a congestion tax in central business districts.

title: In 2019, Jeffrey Epstein Had $600 Million Estate. Files Reveal Who Gets What
content: The trust provided for Jeffrey Epsteins girlfriend to receive much of his property, though most of his residences have since been sold.

title: Marathi TV Actor Turned Social Media Star. Nobody Knew He Stole 17 Bikes Too
content: Police tracked Sunil after a Royal Enfield Bullet belonging to Kurla West resident Sandeep Omprakash Sonkar was stolen on January 21 near the LR Flyover.

title: Sheikh Hasina's Inner Circle On Trial Ahead Of Bangladesh's Elections
content: Bangladesh is headed towards its first general elections after the fall, exile, and death sentence of its longest-serving prime minister, Sheikh Hasina.

title: Supreme Court Again Urges Centre To Reconsider Sonam Wangchuk's Detention
content: The Supreme Court once again asked the Central government to reconsider the detention of climate activist Sonam Wangchuk after noting concerns about his deteriorating health.

title: "How Can They?" Chief Justice Flags '"Gunda Raj' After Lawyer Claims Assault
content: The Supreme Court on Monday delivered a stern rebuke over an alleged incident of violence inside a Delhi courtroom, describing it as a manifestation of "gunda raj" and a direct affront to the rule of law.

title: Video: Slipper-And-Stick Fight In Madhya Pradesh Over Setting Up Kiosk
content: The woman is seen pulling off her slipper and trying to strike the man who picks up a stick and retaliates, striking the woman and then punching her as the crowd gasps.

title: Student Kills Girl, Then Shoots Himself In 3-Second Classroom Horror
content: A first-year law student shot dead his classmate before killing himself with the same gun in Punjab's Tarn Taran district on Monday morning. While his classmate, a girl, died on the spot, the accused was taken to the hospital in critical condition.

title: Adani International School Hosts 'IRIS National Fair' To Boost India's STEM Talent
content: Showcasing India's emerging science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) talent, Adani International School (ADIS), Shantigram, hosted the IRIS National Fair 2025-26 from February 6-8.

title: Parliament Budget Session Live Updates: Lok Sabha Adjourned Again Amid Opposition Protests, Next Sitting At 11:00 AM Tomorrow
content: Parliament Budget Session Live: The proceedings of the Lok Sabha has been adjourned till 11:00 am tomorrow following protests by the Opposition.

title: Canadian Woman Allegedly Harassed During Massage At Radisson In Bengaluru
content: A woman from Canada has filed a police complaint in Bengaluru, alleging that she was harassed by a therapist during a massage session at a private hotel spa. She has accused the therapist of inappropriate behaviour

title: South Korean Crypto Exchange Gives Rs 3.62 Lakh Crore In Big Bitcoin Error
content: Instead of giving winners about 2,000 Korean won (Rs 123), the system ended up distributing at least 2,000 bitcoins to each of 695 accounts. This amounted to around 620,000 bitcoins. At today's value, it's worth over Rs 3.62 lakh crore.
